intro: Randia tinianensis, commonly known as the Tinian randia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, including parts of the Philippines and other island chains. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming during the warmer months. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly rough texture. Randia tinianensis is generally found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
